comments:
I've been creating a customized implementation of the PDE build process as used
by the RelEng team (per ).

It has been running fine under M4, but when I converted to M5 it started to fail
with an exception. If I run the scripts under M4 again they work fine.  I'm not
changing the scripts, just modifying the invocation to point at M4 or M5. I'm
not sure how to proceed with debugging this further.

This is my invocation:
E:\Eclipse-3.1\test>E:\Eclipse-Development\jre\bin\java.exe -classpath
e:\Eclipse-3.1\eclipse\startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -application
org.eclipse.ant.core.antRunner -data e:\eclipse-3.1\eclipse\AntRunnerBatch
-buildfile E:\Ant_Self_Build\AntSystemBuild\JDG2ESystem\build.xml -verbose

It is unlikely that this is a problem with the Eclipse Ant integration...but I 
have been wrong before :-)

What custom or Eclipse tasks / types is your buildfile executing?
I would guess that one of said tasks is incompatible in its static initializer 
between M4 and M5.

If you provide the E:\Ant_Self_Build\AntSystemBuild\JDG2ESystem\build.xml or 
some subset that has the problem I could debug this further to pinpoint the 
problem (or you could :-)). To debug modify your invocation to include the 
following:

-vmArgs -Xdebug -Xnoagent -Djava.compiler=NONE -
Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=y,address=8000

Then remote debug the Ant build using another Eclipse session.

I'll see if I can try the remote debug approach to get more detail.

By custom Ant tasks I meant more my features/plugins in the PDE stack.

I'm running the build scripts referenced by the PDE/Releng team in this draft 
article:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/~checkout~/pde-build-
home/articles/Automated%20Builds/article.html?rev=HEAD&content-type=te

All I've done is customize them to reference the feature I want to build.

That might mean as you suggest, that this is a PDE build error (code in their 
targets).

If you want to cc or reassign to them I'll feed them what detail I can find in 
my next round of debugging.

Darin, could not that be related to bug #86174 (Pat this could affect your
tutorial if you are demonstrating automatic code fetching).
Pat, could you try one experiment: in M5, replace ant.core by the one from M4.

Possible I guess but I don't know how this would cause an 
ExceptionInInitializerError

The evidence is pointing to this being a duplicate of bug 86174.
Sorry for the churn.

I plan to post patches later today for ant core and ant ui plugins.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 86174 ***
